name: Abraham
desc: Father of faith; through him all nations are blessed (Gen 12:1-3).
significance: God’s covenant with Abraham is everlasting and unconditional — it promises land, descendants, and blessing. This covenant stands to this day and is the foundation for Gentile inclusion through faith.

name: Judah
desc: Fourth son of Jacob; received the scepter promise (Gen 49:8-10).
significance: The Messianic line flows through Judah, reaffirming that God’s covenant with Abraham continued through David and ultimately to Christ.

name: David
desc: King to whom God swore an everlasting throne (2 Sam 7).
significance: The Davidic covenant builds on the Abrahamic one, promising a descendant who will reign forever — fulfilled in Jesus.

name: Jesus (Yeshua)
desc: The promised Messiah; fulfiller of the Abrahamic and Davidic covenants.
significance: Through Christ, the blessing of Abraham extends to all nations. The 144,000 in Revelation come from the 12 tribes, showing the covenant with Israel still stands.
